titleStmt.title: William Y. Wiley to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG2590

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Indianapolis Ind Nov 2,, "61
Secretary of State
Frankfort Ken --
Dr Sir
Being in receipt of Commission bearing date Oct 30" 1861. I herewith transmit my oath of office as "Commissioner of Deeds" for the State of Kentucky --

State of Indiana
County of Marion
City of Indianapolis } ss

Be it remembered that on this second day of November A D 1861. before me Luther R Martin Notary Public in and for the County and State aforesaid personally came William Y. Wiley personally to me known who being first by me duly sworn upon his oath says that he will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of his office of "Commissioner" of Deeds" for the State of Kentucky in Indiana --

figure.ab:
NOTARY PUBLIC SEAL
INDIANAPOLIS
MARION COUNTY IND.

body.p: Sworn to and subscribed before me the day and year above written Witness my hand and notarial seal --

Indiana
Oath
Wm Y. Wiley
Comr. of Deeds
Filed Octo 5. 1861
